response.original_title: Trial By Fire: The New York City Fire Museum
response.overview: Housed in a 1904 firehouse — the former home of Engine 30 — this museum chronicles the history of firefighting from colonial times to the present. The museum features horse and hand-drawn fire carriages, fire buckets and parade hats and modern day equipment. Firefighters — many of whom were involved in the World Trade Center tragedy — serve as the museum’s volunteers.
response.title: Trial By Fire: The New York City Fire Museum
